# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:16:18Z

## Rich Terminal Text Rendering Library (Pip Vendored)

This is the complete Rich library (vendored within pip) - a comprehensive Python library for creating rich text and beautiful formatting in the terminal. Rich provides a high-level API for adding colors, styles, tables, progress bars, syntax highlighting, and other advanced terminal features to console applications.

## Core Architecture & Entry Points

### Primary Interface
- **`__init__.py`**: Main entry point providing global console functions (`print()`, `inspect()`, `print_json()`) and console management
- **`console.py`**: The `Console` class is the central rendering engine, handling all terminal output, styling, and format conversion (HTML, SVG, text)

### Text & Styling Foundation
- **`text.py`**: Core `Text` class for styled text manipulation with spans, markup parsing, wrapping, and alignment
- **`style.py`**: Style system with ANSI code generation, attribute management, and CSS conversion
- **`segment.py`**: Low-level rendering primitives that represent styled text segments before ANSI conversion
- **`color.py`**: Comprehensive color management supporting multiple terminal color systems (16-color, 256-color, truecolor)

### Layout & Structure Components
- **`table.py`**: Flexible table rendering with customizable borders, alignment, and responsive column sizing
- **`panel.py`**: Bordered containers for content with titles, padding, and various box styles
- **`columns.py`**: Multi-column layout system with auto-sizing
- **`align.py`**: Horizontal and vertical alignment wrapper for any renderable
- **`padding.py`**: CSS-style padding system for spacing control

### Rich Content Rendering
- **`syntax.py`**: Syntax highlighting using Pygments with themes, line numbers, and customizable styling
- **`markdown.py`**: Markdown to rich text conversion (not shown in files but referenced)
- **`json.py`**: Pretty-printed JSON with syntax highlighting
- **`tree.py`**: Hierarchical tree structures with guide lines and expansion controls
- **`rule.py`**: Horizontal divider lines with optional titles

### Interactive & Dynamic Elements
- **`progress.py`**: Comprehensive progress bar system with task management, file I/O tracking, and threading
- **`live.py`**: Real-time updating displays for progress bars, tables, and other dynamic content
- **`status.py`**: Animated status indicators with spinners
- **`prompt.py`**: Interactive user input with validation and type safety

### Specialized Features
- **`traceback.py`**: Enhanced exception display with syntax highlighting and local variable inspection
- **`pretty.py`**: Advanced object pretty-printing with Rich formatting
- **`logging.py`**: Rich-formatted log handlers with structured output
- **`highlighter.py`**: Text highlighting engines for various content types (JSON, regex, repr output)

### Platform & Integration Support
- **Windows Console Support**: `_win32_console.py`, `_windows.py`, `_windows_renderer.py` provide native Windows terminal integration
- **Jupyter Integration**: `jupyter.py` enables Rich objects to display properly in notebooks
- **Export Capabilities**: Templates and utilities for HTML/SVG export in `_export_format.py`

## Data & Configuration
- **Color Systems**: Comprehensive color palettes (`_palettes.py`), terminal themes (`terminal_theme.py`), and emoji support (`_emoji_codes.py`, `_emoji_replace.py`)
- **Styling Themes**: Default styles (`default_styles.py`) and theme management (`theme.py`, `themes.py`)
- **Unicode Support**: Cell width calculations (`cells.py`, `_cell_widths.py`) for proper text alignment across different scripts

## Utility Modules
- **Layout Algorithms**: Ratio-based space distribution (`_ratio.py`), text wrapping (`_wrap.py`)
- **Control Systems**: Terminal control codes (`control.py`), screen management (`screen.py`)
- **File Operations**: Safe file proxy (`file_proxy.py`), null file objects (`_null_file.py`)

## Key Patterns & Design Principles
- **Rich Protocol**: Objects implement `__rich_console__()` and `__rich_measure__()` for custom rendering
- **Composable Architecture**: All components can be combined and nested
- **Thread Safety**: Live displays and progress tracking include proper synchronization
- **Graceful Degradation**: Automatic fallbacks for different terminal capabilities
- **Performance Optimization**: Extensive caching, lazy evaluation, and efficient Unicode handling

## Public API Surface
The primary interface is through the global console functions in `__init__.py` and direct instantiation of Rich classes like `Console`, `Text`, `Table`, `Progress`, etc. The library follows a "batteries included" philosophy where complex formatting is available through simple, intuitive APIs while still providing low-level access for advanced customization.
